There are various rules for this, for our version: ğŸ· each participant receives the name of someone else to purchase a gift for ğŸ gifts are exchanged at a party ğŸ¤” the receiver is tasked with guessing who the gift-giver was! We thought it'd be particularly fun to do it #rstats style. ## Assigning partners We had our interested classmates sign up on a [Google Form](https://docs.google.com/forms/u/0/),![](/images/2017-11-14/google-form.png) resulting in a Google Sheet with each participant's `name`, `email`, and `interests`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library("googlesheets") library("dplyr") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- gs_url("https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1NHbsjZVhvIxzuivXWQvDBst0oMN7ZcCjCbI8XJeXxJI/edit#gid=860103774") %>% gs_read() ``` ::: We began by making a tibble that has `name` in the first column and assigned a random `partner` in the second. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(525) dat <- tibble( name = df$name, partner = sample(df$name) ) ``` ::: *"But what if someone was assigned to be their own partner!"* you may ask. ![](https://media.giphy.com/media/23WStXFJFKN44/giphy.gif) Have no fear! A `while` loop is here! We allow a `while` loop to iterate until every individual is assigned a partner (who isn't them!). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} while (any(dat$name == dat$partner)) { dat <- tibble( name = df$name, partner = sample(df$name) ) } ``` ::: *This is likely not the most efficient way, but we only had 23 friends so it's* ğŸ‘Œ -- *if you get excited about efficiency and would like to share a quicker way to do it, please do! We* â¤ï¸ *to learn!* **Edit:** Looks like our ğŸ™ was answered!

We then do a join to pull the emails and interests back in. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} df_name <- df[ , c("name", "email")] df_partner <- df[ , c("name", "interests")] dat <- dat %>% left_join(df_name, c("name" = "name")) %>% left_join(df_partner, c("partner" = "name")) ``` ::: ## Sending the email [Karthik](https://twitter.com/_inundata) and I had a blast at the [rOpenSci](https://ropensci.org) unconf creating the ğŸ´ [ponyexpress package](https://github.com/ropenscilabs/ponyexpress) - what a delightful chance to use it! We didn't want the secret to be spoiled (i.e. we didn't want to know who would be buying us gifts!), so we wrote a script to send an email to our classmates. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ## devtools::install_github("ropenscilabs/ponyexpress") library("ponyexpress") ``` ::: ![](https://assets-auto.rbl.ms/248d7dc3241d5585d0d9feba16933a8f5352c8f3fd6fb575c246725b35128824) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} body <- "Dear {name}, You have been assigned to surprise {partner} with a happy gift! {partner} told us they have the following interests: {interests} Remember, the price limit is $20. Happy white elephant-ing, Sarah & Lucy" our_template <- glue::glue(glitter_template) parcel <- parcel_create(dat, sender_name = "Lucy", sender_email = "lucy@myemail.com", subject = "Secret Santa!", template = our_template) parcel_preview(parcel) parcel_send(parcel) ``` ::: This will create an email like this: And that's it!
